content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at approximately (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
• Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Factory burner inserter retrieved at (2.5, 16.5) and a dedicated burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5)
• Assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5)
Use-case: Processing copper plates into copper cable via coordinated inserter and assembling machine operations.

### Belt Depot for Extraction System at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden chest serving as belt depot at (3.5, 15.5)
• Transport belt segment positioned adjacent at (4.5, 15.5)
• Depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP
Use-case: Acting as the interface point for connecting the extraction system output into the belt network.

### Electricity Generator at (-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
• Steam engine at (-0.5, 24.5)
• Boiler at (-5.5, 24.0)
• Offshore pump at (-7.5, 25.5)
Use-case: Producing power for the factory system through the steam-driven process.

### Extraction System at (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
• Burner inserter located at (-3.5, 27.5) with its drop position at (-3.5, 28.5)
Use-case: Serving as the source side for resource extraction and feeding items into the connected belt network.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Target Errors  
 – Problem: Repeated errors indicate that transport belts were attempted to be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object.  
 – Tip: Always insert an appropriate inserter to serve as the belt’s target so that the transport belt feeds items into the inserter rather than directly into a steam engine.

• Entity Placement Range and Inventory Issues  
 – Problem: Wooden chest placement failed because the target position was too far from the player’s position, and in another instance, due to insufficient inventory.  
 – Tip: Move the player close enough to the desired location before placing an entity and verify that the required items are present in the inventory.

• Variable Naming and Definition Errors  
 – Problem: A NameError occurred when referencing an undefined variable (e.g. ‘target_chest’).  
 – Tip: Ensure all variable names are correctly defined and consistently used to prevent referencing errors.
